channel.title: orgmode on ArMD
channel.description: Recent content in orgmode on ArMD

item.title: Plot graphs in emacs org-mode
item.description: I use Emacs as the IDE for most of my projects, one of which required plotting a graph to debug an issue. I have summarised the steps I followed to generate a graph using Emacs, with a mac. Prerequisites Download and install Xcode from App Store Install command line tools xcode-select install Install gnuplot - the graphs will be powered by gnuplot sudo port install gnuplot +qt5 + x11 +aquaterm +wxwidgets Refer this setup guide for more details

item.title: Tables in emacs org-mode
item.description: Emacs has native support for tables but org mode makes using tables a breeze. This will be a quick primer for org-mode tables. org-mode must be enabled in your buffer for the remainder of the post. Tables can be accessed without org-mode but have a few more extra steps. Setting up a Table A table can be created in any of the following ways Start typing with | followed by a column name and another |, press TAB.
